title: I have to give Riot genuine props.
body:
So, I was watching a new gbay video yesterday. It's about an hour and a half long about everything he LOVES in League of Legends. I wanted a video to fall asleep to so I took of my glasses and kinda watched a bit.

But you know what?

I could tell what characters were fighting in the footage.

I'm blind as a bat without my glasses but I could recognize Riven by the angle at which she swings her sword, vs Lucian by the afterimage on his dash and the way he walks and runs.

Like, I'm able to tell my attacks, models, and even basic movements who's fighting who.

Riot has always had the "Sword Swing" Philosophy where if you give every champ a sword they'd all swing it differently. 

And they do. Riven smashes and swings while Yasuo slashs and stabs.

Every character is so unique and different and their moves look different and their models are unique and even just looking at a character I could guess some of their mechanics.

They did a great job with their philosophy, and integrating gameplay with story and personality.

Good job, Rito.

It's not really about sentimentality, though. This is one of the basic principles when it comes to character design. Characters' silhouettes should be clear and distinguishable to easily convey who that character is and what they are about. This isn't something that just applies to TF2. Games that follow this rule generally look better than games that don't.

I often confuse different characters with each other, and what's worse is the skins make it nearly impossible to identify who you are playing against, until you get whacked with a signature you weren't expecting.

Riot has always made sure that readability is key, and not having that makes me appreciate it more. :-D

I listened to Gbay's long video about what he loves about League, I really enjoyed what he had to say. I'm proud of Riot for creating and maintaining such a great game and keeping the community happy. Ranked mode keeps me playing and happy being able to compete against others. It feels good to earn a rank and work towards improving where you'll actually see it work while you keep playing. I don't see League as a whole dying or weakening anytime soon because Riot knows what they are doing and they are listening to the community and actually care about their game.

I have been around for a really long time, back when half the champs had the mega man feet, and I have to say, for the most part I really like the game, sometimes I take some time off, or skip a season of ranked, but I always come back, I am pretty sure I'm at least partly responsible for one of the devs kids going to college haha, it is a pretty game, and the designs of the champions are always interesting, with fun nods to pop culture tucked here and there
